intro: Eria kajewskii, commonly known as the Kajewski’s orchid, is a species of epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining potting media to prevent root rot.
